intro: Acyntha lanuginosa, commonly known as the downy acynthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. The plant has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive appearance. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
